intro: Psychotria vanoverberghii, commonly known as the Vanoverbergh's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, reddish berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Psychotria vanoverberghii is often found in humid, shaded understory environments of tropical rainforests.
